comments.body: Hi @a14n, could you explain why this newline check was added?
I think I added this assert because the old method didn't work for `s` with a `\n` inside.
The new method appears to handle any backslash character by generating a raw string. Maybe this assert isn't really needed.
The assert is currently needed because the method does not handle `\n`. We could change it to use triple quote if `s` contains `\n` but it's a different handling than `\\`

You're right; it's newline characters that are disallowed, not a backslash followed by an 'n'.

Values in JSON files - and ARB files are JSON files -  cannot contain newline characters, so it makes sense that this method  doesn't allow values to contain newline characters.
